Cough: Caused by immune-mediated inflammation of the lungs, often seen in pneumonitis.
Shortness of Breath: Results from reduced lung function due to pneumonitis or cardiac dysfunction like myocarditis.
Diarrhea: Triggered by immune-related inflammation of the gastrointestinal tract, particularly in colitis.
Abdominal Pain: Results from immune-mediated damage to the gastrointestinal tract or pancreas.
Fatigue: Caused by systemic inflammation, endocrine dysfunction, or organ-specific damage such as hepatitis or myocarditis.
Jaundice: Occurs due to impaired liver function from immune-mediated hepatitis.
Skin Rash: Results from immune-mediated inflammation of the skin or hypersensitivity reactions.
Joint Pain: Caused by immune-mediated inflammation of the synovial joints, mimicking autoimmune arthritis.
Visual Disturbances: Occurs due to inflammation of the uveal tract or optic nerve in uveitis or neurological toxicities.
Chest Pain: Results from immune-related inflammation of the heart (myocarditis) or pericardium.
Fever: Triggered by systemic inflammation associated with immune activation.
Weight Loss: Occurs due to chronic inflammation or reduced nutrient absorption in gastrointestinal IRAEs.
Muscle Weakness: Results from immune-mediated myopathy or neurological toxicities affecting motor neurons.
Confusion: Caused by immune-mediated encephalitis or other central nervous system toxicities.
Bruising: Occurs due to reduced platelet count from immune-mediated thrombocytopenia.
Bleeding: Results from impaired clotting ability due to thrombocytopenia or liver dysfunction.
Nausea and Vomiting: Triggered by immune-mediated gastrointestinal or pancreatic inflammation.
Dry Mouth: Results from salivary gland involvement or endocrine dysfunction.
Palpitations: Caused by inflammation or damage to the cardiac conduction system in myocarditis.
